str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
(a) of time: still, yet, even now, (b) of degree: even, further, more, in addition. Perhaps akin to etos; 'yet, ' still.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To proclaim, herald, preach. Of uncertain affinity; to herald, especially divine truth.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: To pursue, hence: I persecute. A prolonged form of a primary verb dio; to pursue; by implication, to persecute.
Then, therefore, since. Probably from airo; a particle denoting an inference more or less decisive.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A snare, stumbling-block, cause for error. Scandal; probably from a derivative of kampto; a trap-stick, i.e. Snare.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From kata and argeo; to be entirely idle, literally or figuratively.
